intro: Teclea ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty teclea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough, textured surface. Teclea ferruginea is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and riverbanks.
